title: How to Teach a Child to Do a Handstand

steps.title: Find a safe place to learn.
steps.content: Find a safe place to learn. Clear the area of any sharp or hard objects that might cause an injury if the child falls on them. Choose a spot with plenty of room to move around. [1] X Research source Grass, gym mats or a mattress on the ground are good ground surfaces.

steps.title: Set up suitable equipment to help make the learning easier.
steps.content: Set up suitable equipment to help make the learning easier. For example, be near a wall, or use a chair or sofa. For softness, include a gym or yoga mat. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Have the child warm up.
steps.content: Have the child warm up. Have fun with this. Make up games that will keep the child full of energy. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Have a wheelbarrow race.
steps.content: Have a wheelbarrow race. It might seem crazy but it will get them the hang of being upside down. (If you don't know, a wheelbarrow race involves one person "walking" with their hands on the ground, and a second person walking or running behind the first person while holding that person's legs off the ground.)

steps.title: Explain to the child how to avoid injury while doing a handstand.
steps.content: Explain to the child how to avoid injury while doing a handstand. Show them how to roll while falling.

steps.title: Stand near a wall or sofa chair.
steps.content: Stand near a wall or sofa chair. Have the child practice kicking up into the air and resting against the wall. Then help the child with the landing. Spot the child at all times and help to hold the child in position while he or she gets the feel for the handstand. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Go away from a wall when the child feels more confident.
steps.content: Go away from a wall when the child feels more confident. Continue to spot them as they kick (holding up as needed), then help them to land again. Repeat as often as needed but ensure that the child has breaks to avoid getting dizzy or tired. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Keep practicing this daily.
steps.content: Keep practicing this daily. Eventually the child will get the hang of it, in their own time. This takes time.

steps.title: Offer a reward for improvement and success.
steps.content: Offer a reward for improvement and success. It'll take time, so be patient.
